page.title: 06Proj 2 The Torpoint Ferry
page.content: {The Torpoint Ferry history. { { }Torpoint is a fairly new town,the first buildings were not built until 1737.The nearby villages of Antony and St. John are much older.The people of these 2 villages and big coun try houses needed to get across to the markets and Plymouth and Stonehouse to buy and sell produce and surplies.They went across the River Tamar by Market Boats which sailed from St. John on Tuesday,Thursday and Saturday.About 1730 some kind of unoffical ferry started operating,it was owned by the Carews and the Mount Edgecombe families.The reason for the ferrys starting was the building of Devonport Dockyard.Many of the cottages for the workers were built in Torpoint.There were horse boats and foot boats ferrys
